newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland says no quick free tract pact with Russia.
newsitem.headline: Poland says no quick free tract pact with Russia.

text.p: Poland wants to liberalise trade with Russia but cannot sign a free trade agreement with Moscow soon because it is not a member of the World Trade Organisation (WTO), Prime Minister Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz said on Tuesday.
"We cannot rule it out (signing free trade agreement with Russia), but it would have to be subject to negotiations that would not be easy and short," said Cimoszwicz, who last week visited Russia.
"We have our standards of signing such agreements and these include a WTO membership," he told a news conference.

He said that under a joint declaration on trade liberalisation he had signed in Russia, the two countries' experts would work until March next year to lay the groundwork for further talks on the issue.
Cimoszewicz said any trade relaxation with Russia would be discussed with the European Union, which Poland wants to join at the start of the next century.
Trade between Poland and Russia collapsed in 1990 after the fall of communism but has begun to grow in the last few years. It is forecast to rise by about $1 billion in 1996 to $4 billion.
